data.title: Cerberus Canis | The Mesh Directory
data.meta_description: A look at the Second Life Cerberus Canis mesh head. The perfect guide to help decide if this is the head you need for your avatar.
data.text:
This is an overview of the Cerberus Canis mesh head for Second Life avatars. The information may also apply to the other Cerberus heads however the photos are only of Cerberus Canis, and the list is what comes with Cerberus Canis. Other heads have slightly different content. As always I strongly encourage you to demo before making any final purchases. To browse other mesh heads, bodies, and more check out The Mesh Directory.

Basic Info

Product Specifics

Creator – Cerberus

Product – Canis

Price – L$349

Review Version – 2.8

Included Parts

Body – No

Eyes – Yes

Ears – Yes

Head – Yes

Skin – Yes*

Expressions & Animations

Eye Control – No

Typing/Voice Animations – Yes

Static Expressions – Yes

Facial Animations – Yes

Included Gestures – Yes

Included Customization

Bakes on Mesh (BOM)

Eyebrows – Yes*

Hairbases – No

Makeup – Yes*

Eyes – Yes

Applier

Eyebrows – No

Hairbases – No

Makeup – No

Eyes – Yes (Tinting via HUD)

Miscellaneous

Teeth – Yes

Lashes – Yes

Piercings – No

Copy – Yes

Transfer – No

Mod – Yes

Compatibility

Bakes on Mesh (BOM)

Bakes on Mesh (BOM) – Yes

EvoX Skin Compatible – No

Applier

Skin Appliers – Yes

Cosmetic Appliers – Yes

Applier Save Slots – No

Omega Compatible – Yes

Miscellaneous

Materials Enabled – Yes

Universal Neck Standard ?When used with the same skin tone, heads and bodies both using the Universal Neck Standard result in a seamless neck. – No

Additional Neck Sizing Options – No*

HUD

Pros, Neutral Notes, and Cons

Other things of note to consider that haven’t been mentioned above.

Pros

Cerberus is a popular brand for furry products. This makes it easy to find third party products made for them

Their heads are very expressive out of the box, and you can purchase first and third party animators for even more expression options.

Neutral Notes

* While skin and makeup are provided, it’s mostly just an example skin to give you an idea how the head can look. The only body it’s compatible with is Regalia. The head CAN be used with other skins and bodies, and most folks who use Canis either purchase a mod kit designed specifically for Canis or make things themselves.

Cons

* There is no neck with the Cerberus Canis head. A lot of folks use third party free options such as Apricot Paw’s SLUV Neck Extender or NARCOTIC SLUMBER’s Neck Extenders. You will not achieve a seamless neck with this head.

What’s In The Box

Inworld Location

Marketplace

SL Group

Discord

Example of Cerberus Canis In Use

Head – Cerberus: Canis (No ear version)

Body – eBODY: Reborn

Skin/Markings/Makeup/Ears– MODZ: Angeles F Pink

Shape – Modified version of MODZ‘s Female Shape

Hair – RAW HOUSE: Bear X

Eyes – Whisk (Formerly Okaie): Gentle Eyes

Tongue – NARCOTIC SLUMBER: BOM Canis/Lupis split tongue

Glasses– NARCOTIC SLUMBER: Spunkers glasses Canis/Lupus

Piercings – Extasis: C-Canis Piercings

Top – CryBunBun: Your Waifu

Pose – FOXCITY: Influencer-1

Location – My private home (most everything you can see is from Studio Skye and Hayabusa)

Windlight (EEP) – Bryn Oh: Bryn Oh’s BOX MetaLES (This may be included as part of your viewer. Search your inventory and see!)

Do you have a Cerberus Canis head? Tell me what you think.

Are there questions you have that I didn’t answer? Ask away!

Would you like to see more info included? Let me know.

Always feel free to use the comment section.
